Title: Mbah’s wife distributes bags of fertilizers to farmers in Enugu
Summary: Gov. Peter Mbah’s wife, Mrs Nkechinyere Mbah, has distributed bags of fertilisers to registered farmers across 17 Council Areas of Enugu State . The bags were distributed to enhance their production and ensure food security in the state .

Title: FRSC impounds 151 vehicles in Zamfara
Summary: The Zamfara Sector Command of the Federal Road Safety Corps impounded 151 vehicles during a special patrol in September . Sector Commander Aliyu Ma’aji disclosed this in an interview with the News Agency of Nigeria .

Title: 24th FIFA U-20 World Cup: Argentina crush Nigeria 4-0
Summary: Six-time champions Argentina defeated Nigeria 4-0 on Wednesday to eliminate the Flying Eagles from the 2025 FIFA U-20 World Cup in Chile .

Title: INEC: Court orders IGP Egbetokun to arrest Yakubu
Summary: Federal High Court orders IGP to arrest the immediate past chairman of the Independent National Electoral Commission . Prof Mahmood Yakubu is accused of contempt of court .

Title: Ozoro, Ughelli host Zenith/Delta Principals’ Cup semifinals
Summary: Ozoro, Ughelli host Zenith/Delta Principals’ Cup semifinals . The yearly competition kicked off in Asaba on September 18, and now the final four teams are in action .

Title: Obi not my leader, I’m most important politician from South-East — Orji Kalu
Summary: Kalu declared himself the region’s most influential politician . Kalu dismissed suggestions that Obi is the political leader of the South-East .

Title: Cross River to enforce crackdown on illegal online betting
Summary: Cross River State Government has begun a sweeping clampdown on illegal and non-compliant online lottery and sports betting operators following a new partnership aimed at sanitising the gaming sector . The Director-General of the Cross River state Lotteries and Gaming Agency, Hon. Micheal Eja, told journalists in […]

Title: NANS warns against sabotage of private refineries, threatens nationwide protest
Summary: The National Association of Nigerian Students (NANS) has cautioned against actions or policies that could undermine the development of Nigeria’s petroleum refining sector . At a mass rally held simultaneously in Abuja, Asaba, NANS calls for stronger government commitment to refinery revitalisation .

Title: NYCN, youth ministry clash over council leadership
Summary: Council insists its court-recognised leadership under Sukubo remains valid . Urges youths to ignore purported takeover by Ministry, CAC .

Title: Court orders arrest of Prof Mahmood Yakubu for contempt
Summary: Prof Mahmood Yakubu stepped down as the Chairman of the Independent National Electoral Commission, INEC, having completed his term in office .
